description: Daria Tomenko secretly intervenes to sabotage the memory-erasure protocol scheduled to wipe testimonies from 'ghost users' before tribunal hearings, risking her safety to preserve critical evidence of BCI abuses.

Comprehensive, unsuppressed testimonies from 'invisible citizens,' ex-enforcers, and whistleblowers are presented at citizen-led tribunals, exposing the full extent of BCI disappearances and secret purges; public outrage and momentum for justice surge.
Mass public debates flare as evidence ignites calls for prosecution and reform. Long-standing alliances within the Council and their factions publicly fracture amid rising demands for accountability.
Crowds gather citywide for the high-profile, citizen-driven trial of Directorate leaders implicated in BCI crimes. The event exposes the city's moral divide between justice and reconciliation.
Citizen groups propose a new city charter founded on transparency and ethical oversight, marking a turning point in Stenograd as citizens reclaim the governance process from algorithmic rule.
